comments:
If a build failed message does not contain a line number like the following:

BUILD FAILED: java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\Darins\Debugger\20021213
\eclipse\runtime-workspace\ExternalTesting\file:common.xml (The system cannot 
find the file specified)

you will get:
java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -132

Fixed in BuildFailedTracker.

To reproduce problem use the following two buildfiles:
<?xml version="1.0"  encoding="iso-8859-1"?>
<!DOCTYPE project   [
<!ENTITY common SYSTEM "simplecommon.xml">
]>

<project name="SomeProject" default="main" basedir=".">
  
<target name="main" depends="externaltarget1">
		 <echo message="test"/>
</target>
&common;
</project>

----simplecommon.xml----
<target name="externaltarget1" depends="nestedexternaltarget1">
		 <echo message="externaltarget1 in common"/>
</target>

Run the build once successfully.
Then edit ENTITY to read simplcommon.xml (an error)
Relaunch last external tool...BOOM

Verified.
Please update the build notes, Darin S.
